WM.content: [exemplary nature of sun in relation to metaphor] if sun is always metaphorical, it has lustre [Mallarmé], is an artificial construction, always other than itself, emerging from itself (father, eye, seed, fire, egg) > via Du Marsais, the philosophical metaphor light of the spirit is a detour w/in (in sight of) reappropriation, presence, etc. (from Platonic eidos to Hegelian Idea), a trope, a borrowed dwelling (house) > here, light is one metaphor among metaphors, and borrowed dwelling, expropriation, becomes metaphor of metaphor

PS.linkedContent: Artaud’s resistance to clinical/critical exegeses: protest itself against exemplification itself > destroy history of dualist metaphysics, render doctor/critic helpless: art w/out works, language w/out trace

PS.content: Artaud establishes link btwn essence of theft & origin of discourse: theft of speech as possibility of theft, theft would constitute structure of the example as such
PS.linkedContent: Artaud establishes link btwn essence of theft & origin of discourse: theft of speech as possibility of theft, theft would constitute structure of the example as such

PS.content: we could not avoid the violence of the example the moment we proscribed it, but perhaps we can better understand the necessity of this incoherence
PS.linkedContent: we could not avoid the violence of the example the moment we proscribed it, but perhaps we can better understand the necessity of this incoherence

DPi.content: Rousseau’s 3 reservations re: DP (this chapter one of most tormented/interesting in The Social Contract): 1) DP not a civil law but law of war 2) not the general but a particular act of sovereign 3) Rousseau rejects exemplarity of punishment, believes guilty party can always be rehabilitated, but affirms DP when danger is too much
DPi.linkedContent: Rousseau’s 3 reservations re: DP (this chapter one of most tormented/interesting in The Social Contract): 1) DP not a civil law but law of war 2) not the general but a particular act of sovereign 3) Rousseau rejects exemplarity of punishment, believes guilty party can always be rehabilitated, but affirms DP when danger is too much

DPi.content: logic of fascination best argument against punishment as exemplarity: bad example risks becoming fascinating martyr, hero, the good example [Genet] (perversion of the imitation of Christ)
DPi.linkedContent: logic of fascination best argument against punishment as exemplarity: bad example risks becoming fascinating martyr, hero, the good example [Genet] (perversion of the imitation of Christ)

DPi.content: exemplarity of Hugolian economy considerably exceeds the singular genius who represents it so well
DPi.linkedContent: exemplarity of Hugolian economy considerably exceeds the singular genius who represents it so well

DPi.content: nursing no illusion should not prevent us from being militant, this is composure (le sang-froid), courage, militate w/ cool heads (de sang-froid) [Derrida occupying position of the condemned and the abolitionist], grace, passion, love, J.C., as copy or abyss of exemplarity > Derrida doesn’t care if he’s imitating Christ, he wants to save what is left of life
DPi.linkedContent: nursing no illusion should not prevent us from being militant, this is composure (le sang-froid), courage, militate w/ cool heads (de sang-froid) [Derrida occupying position of the condemned and the abolitionist], grace, passion, love, J.C., as copy or abyss of exemplarity > Derrida doesn’t care if he’s imitating Christ, he wants to save what is left of life

TB.content: Babel, exemplary: myth of myth, translation of translation > tells need for figures, tropes, for translation inadequate to compensate for what multiplicity denies us
TB.linkedContent: Babel, exemplary: myth of myth, translation of translation > tells need for figures, tropes, for translation inadequate to compensate for what multiplicity denies us

TB.content: metaphor of metaphor, narrative of narrative: not only structure hollowing itself out like that, but does so in its own way > its idiom would have to be saved
TB.linkedContent: metaphor of metaphor, narrative of narrative: not only structure hollowing itself out like that, but does so in its own way > its idiom would have to be saved

CHM.content: if exclusion of madness is fundamental structure of historicity, the origin of history, then Foucault’s example [re: “classical” moment] is a sample (échantillon) not a model
CHM.linkedContent: if exclusion of madness is fundamental structure of historicity, the origin of history, then Foucault’s example [re: “classical” moment] is a sample (échantillon) not a model

CHM.content: or could he show it to be a unique exclusion, exemplary, an example revelatory by privilege?
CHM.linkedContent: or could he show it to be a unique exclusion, exemplary, an example revelatory by privilege?

Gi.content: Dasein: exemplary entity for the reading of the meaning of Being
Gi.linkedContent: Dasein: exemplary entity for the reading of the meaning of Being

REST.content: Heidegger uses example of shoes to guide his analysis [mentioned before Van Gogh’s picture], a paradigm of thing as “product” > paradigm, a very noble philosophical tradition dating back to Plato, shoes’re the exemplary example of the intermediate place (Zwischenstellung), btwn the mere thing & the work [Lacoue-Labarthe’s inter-posture]
REST.linkedContent: Heidegger uses example of shoes to guide his analysis [mentioned before Van Gogh’s picture], a paradigm of thing as “product” > paradigm, a very noble philosophical tradition dating back to Plato, shoes’re the exemplary example of the intermediate place (Zwischenstellung), btwn the mere thing & the work [Lacoue-Labarthe’s inter-posture]

REST.content: Derrida imagines a gallery filled w/ all the female examples (figures) Heidegger uses
REST.linkedContent: Derrida imagines a gallery filled w/ all the female examples (figures) Heidegger uses

REST.content: for Heidegger, truth of the being-product is not that of the example (the particular shoes)
REST.linkedContent: for Heidegger, truth of the being-product is not that of the example (the particular shoes)

PIO.content: constative (discovering, unveiling, pointing out [manifester], dire ce qui est); performative (producing, instituting, transforming) > “Fable” is co-implication of these 2 values; “Fable” is exemplary > invents by means of enunciation (performs/describes, operates/states)
PIO.linkedContent: constative (discovering, unveiling, pointing out [manifester], dire ce qui est); performative (producing, instituting, transforming) > “Fable” is co-implication of these 2 values; “Fable” is exemplary > invents by means of enunciation (performs/describes, operates/states)

PIO.content: Kant: talent for inventing things is called genius, unlike mere imitators, the inventor’s work is exemplary, it serves as a model (Beispeil) (exemplar) to be imitated
PIO.linkedContent: Kant: talent for inventing things is called genius, unlike mere imitators, the inventor’s work is exemplary, it serves as a model (Beispeil) (exemplar) to be imitated

TR.content: Rousseau’s wager, incalculability of absolute perhaps in which contradiction btwn exemplarity & “without example” can survive
TR.linkedContent: Rousseau’s wager, incalculability of absolute perhaps in which contradiction btwn exemplarity & “without example” can survive

WAP.content: childhood as pure memory, not yet speculation; young Hegel, very gifted, an example (pour example), the essence of a possibility, not exemplary (en example): all children should be able like young Hegel to play role, figure, of moment in pedagogy of the mind
WAP.linkedContent: childhood as pure memory, not yet speculation; young Hegel, very gifted, an example (pour example), the essence of a possibility, not exemplary (en example): all children should be able like young Hegel to play role, figure, of moment in pedagogy of the mind

EJQB.content: [vis-à-vis Jabès] situation of Jew exemplary for situation of poet
EJQB.linkedContent: [vis-à-vis Jabès] situation of Jew exemplary for situation of poet

AFR.content: invention of a new science: “new combinations” exist (new science at once example and discovery of this) > generative or combinative model (separately) insufficient
AFR.linkedContent: invention of a new science: “new combinations” exist (new science at once example and discovery of this) > generative or combinative model (separately) insufficient

AFR.content: though, acc. Condillac, articulated language as system of arbitrary signs is only 1 of 3 kinds of signs, once it proves the best example, exemplary, it draws, envelops in advance, everything which precedes it: upsets the symmetry to its own benefit [great example of exemplary]
AFR.linkedContent: though, acc. Condillac, articulated language as system of arbitrary signs is only 1 of 3 kinds of signs, once it proves the best example, exemplary, it draws, envelops in advance, everything which precedes it: upsets the symmetry to its own benefit [great example of exemplary]

IW.content: exemplarity (rather than paradigm): when “nation” declares itself, by virtue of its singularity, to be charged w/ exemplary testimony, universal message [e.g. Germans, Jews]
IW.linkedContent: exemplarity (rather than paradigm): when “nation” declares itself, by virtue of its singularity, to be charged w/ exemplary testimony, universal message [e.g. Germans, Jews]

IW.content: exemplarism (center of our reflection on nationality): our Beispiel (example) must be followed as a model (Vorbild) to recognize our Vormacht (hegemony, preeminence): if Beispiel is exemplary, not indifferent case in series, then this statement is a tautology
IW.linkedContent: exemplarism (center of our reflection on nationality): our Beispiel (example) must be followed as a model (Vorbild) to recognize our Vormacht (hegemony, preeminence): if Beispiel is exemplary, not indifferent case in series, then this statement is a tautology

IW.content: exemplary as a pre-model, a pre-formative model, an ideal
IW.linkedContent: exemplary as a pre-model, a pre-formative model, an ideal

D.content: Soller’s Numbers is exemplary re: the reader, cette fois enfin, the text shows (montrée) that a reader cannot choose his/her place in a text > does so by composing surfaces retournées & par une mise en scène matérielle exacte

D.content: life & presence as privileged examples [of folding back onto their own limit, folding back in their very triggering] > inscribes difference in heart of life
D.linkedContent: life & presence as privileged examples [of folding back onto their own limit, folding back in their very triggering] > inscribes difference in heart of life

HST.content: experience, exercise of impossible hospitality: “the exemplary experience of deconstruction” > deconstruction of the concept, concept of concept, of the at-home
HST.linkedContent: experience, exercise of impossible hospitality: “the exemplary experience of deconstruction” > deconstruction of the concept, concept of concept, of the at-home

HST.content: acc. Massignon, Islam looks to Abraham more than Christianity > Islam is most faithful, exemplary heir, of the hospitality of hôte Abraham > Iqrā: right of hospitality
HST.linkedContent: acc. Massignon, Islam looks to Abraham more than Christianity > Islam is most faithful, exemplary heir, of the hospitality of hôte Abraham > Iqrā: right of hospitality

HST.content: an example is always a substitutable substitute > “you, for example” often  violent address of one who has power/authority to take hostage: inscribes possible replaceability in address to other
HST.linkedContent: an example is always a substitutable substitute > “you, for example” often violent address of one who has power/authority to take hostage: inscribes possible replaceability in address to other

HST.content: exemplary substitution, child substitution (steal a child & replace w/ another), irreplaceable substitution > if so: every substitution recalls child substitution (the child is the first substitute)
HST.linkedContent: exemplary substitution, child substitution (steal a child & replace w/ another), irreplaceable substitution > if so: every substitution recalls child substitution (the child is the first substitute)

C.content: little princeps coffin is not given, not a prior given that would be natural, autochthonous: “models,” examples, referents (usually are)
C.linkedContent: little princeps coffin is not given, not a prior given that would be natural, autochthonous: “models,” examples, referents (usually are)

C.content: paradeigmatizō: to propose as a model, to blame, hound someone so to dishonor him; paradeigmatismos: an infamous punishment to make an example > (hi)story of coffin, the condemned example: an (exemplary) sentencing of the example: damned paradigm—to death!

TN.content: [is Christianity the only idealizing anesthesia, neutralization, universalism—or one case?]
TN.linkedContent: [is Christianity the only idealizing anesthesia, neutralization, universalism—or one case?]

TN.content: acc. de Biran, touch as transcendental, “faculty of movement,” withdraws from order of sensibility: exemplary sense (comparing other “senses” to touch: more or less sense on both sides of analogy)
TN.linkedContent: acc. de Biran, touch as transcendental, “faculty of movement,” withdraws from order of sensibility: exemplary sense (comparing other “senses” to touch: more or less sense on both sides of analogy)

TN.content: for de Biran, the hand is irreplaceable/dominant (teleological) and it’s pregnant w/ every kind of metonymy (pedagogical): best ontoteleological figure, best rhetorical figure
TN.linkedContent: for de Biran, the hand is irreplaceable/dominant (teleological) and it’s pregnant w/ every kind of metonymy (pedagogical): best ontoteleological figure, best rhetorical figure

TN.content: “transcendentalism” always guided by such surreptitious exemplarism
TN.linkedContent: “transcendentalism” always guided by such surreptitious exemplarism

TN.content: the 3 values of exemplarism [re: hand/touch]: 1) l’échantillon quelconque (random sample), indifferent 2) teleological value—best example 3) et surtout, un simulacre d’échantillon dont le symptôme trahirait une autre téléologie cachée: symptom of a metonymy, because touch always has been figural, some figural substitute courant sans fin to its “proper” abyss
TN.linkedContent: the 3 values of exemplarism [re: hand/touch]: 1) l’échantillon quelconque (random sample), indifferent 2) teleological value—best example 3) et surtout, un simulacre d’échantillon dont le symptôme trahirait une autre téléologie cachée: symptom of a metonymy, because touch always has been figural, some figural substitute courant sans fin to its “proper” abyss

TN.content: se toucher toi—unforgettable event, sans example, deprives us of all “for example,” an event from which one should re-partir, to prepare for another departure (autre départ)
TN.linkedContent: se toucher toi—unforgettable event, sans example, deprives us of all “for example,” an event from which one should re-partir, to prepare for another departure (autre départ)

TN.content: via Nancy, there is no “the” technical is an exemplary example, plus qu’un exemple, gives privileged access to all “there is no ‘the’…”’s > le vertige quasi transcendantal
TN.linkedContent: via Nancy, there is no “the” technical is an exemplary example, plus qu’un exemple, gives privileged access to all “there is no ‘the’…”’s > le vertige quasi transcendantal

TN.content: it’s because there’s some technical (which there is not) that one can infinitely repeat examples that deconstruct very properness/unity itself of all essences, “beings”

E.content: Kant’s exemplorality, exemplary orality, the mouth—os as absolute of every analogon: mouth is the measure of taste, of good art, it’s also the measure of bad taste (consumptive taste): one expressive (emissive) the other vomitive (emitic) > 2 means of entering/leaving the mouth

for Lévi-Strauss, each “comme” and “de même” authorize analogy btwn phonology and sociology: phonology exemplary as the example in a series, not a regulative ideal

FV.content: [re: Benveniste on Aristotle’s categories (see p. 416n), Freud referring to The Emperor’s New Clothes] example of illustrative jubilation, treats element of its “scientific” discourse as marvelous paradigm there to be found, happily available (disponible) for instructing discourse
